Noun: the layer of air near the earth is cooler than an overlying layer
abnormal condition in which an organ is turned inward or inside out (as when the upper part of the uterus is pulled into the cervical canal after childbirt)
a chemical process in which the direction of optical rotation of a substance is reversed from dextrorotatory to levorotary or vice versa
the reversal of the normal order of words
a term formerly used to mean taking on the gender role of the opposite sex
turning upside down; setting on end
the act of turning inside out
